info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 11:31PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT MONROE...SOUTHEASTERN NOBLE... SOUTHEASTERN BELMONT...SOUTHEASTERN ALLEGHENY...GREENE...FAYETTE... SOUTHERN WASHINGTON...SOUTHERN WESTMORELAND...OHIO...WETZEL... MARSHALL...MONONGALIA...NORTHERN PRESTON AND MARION COUNTIES THROUGH 1215 AM EDT... At 1130 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Jeannette to 9 miles northwest of Washington. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Morgantown, Greensburg, McKeesport, Fairmont, Washington, Uniontown, Jeannette, Moundsville, Latrobe, Connellsville, New Martinsville, Waynesburg, Westover, Woodsfield, Mannington, Star City, Gastonville, West Mifflin, Murrysville, and South Park Township. This includes the following highways... Interstate 68 in West Virginia between mile markers 1 and 27. Interstate 70 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 7 and 15, and between mile markers 18 and 57. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 60 and 100. Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 16 and 19. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 37. Interstate 79 in West Virginia between mile markers 131 and 160. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for east central Ohio...southwestern Pennsylvania...and northern and northeastern West Virginia.
